org.pathvisio.paver

Class JSuggestArea

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
            • javax.swing.JTextArea
              • org.pathvisio.paver.JSuggestArea
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable

    public class JSuggestArea
extends javax.swing.JTextArea
    JSuggestArea Class.

    Provides a text-field that makes suggestions using a provided data-vector. You might have seen this on Google (tm), this is the Java implementation.

    Author:
    David von Ah Changed into JSuggestArea, Christ Leemans
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setSuggestFirst

        public boolean setSuggestFirst(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> first,
                      java.lang.String firstsuf)
        Sets new data used to suggest similar words for the first word. words are separated by tabs
        Parameters:
        first - Vector containing available words
        firstsuf - suffix to put behind word when auto-completing
        Returns:
        success, true unless the data-vector was null

      • setSuggestSecond

        public boolean setSuggestSecond(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> second,
                       java.lang.String secondsuf)
        Sets new data used to suggest similar words for the second word. words are separated by tabs
        Parameters:
        second - Vector containing available words
        secondsuf - suffix to put behind word when auto-completing
        Returns:
        success, true unless the data-vector was null

      • setSuggestThird

        Sets new data used to suggest similar words for the third word. words are separated by tabs
        Parameters:
        third - Vector containing available words
        thirdsuf - suffix to put behind word when auto-completing
        Returns:
        success, true unless the data-vector was null

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getSuggestData(int i)
                                                  throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Get all words that are available for suggestion.
        Returns:
        Vector containing Strings
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the integer is not between 0 and 3
